title: Linux seq Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the versatile seq command in Linux, learn how to generate numeric sequences, and customize them with step size and formatting.

meta.title: Linux seq Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the versatile seq command in Linux, learn how to generate numeric sequences, and customize them with step size and formatting.
meta.keywords: Linux, seq command, numeric sequences, step size, formatting, command-line utilities

steps.title: Understand the Purpose and Syntax of the seq Command

verify.name: Verify the understanding of seq command syntax
verify.hint: Ensure that you can generate a simple sequence of numbers from 1 to 5 using the `seq` command.

steps.title: Generate Numeric Sequences with the seq Command

verify.name: Verify generating numeric sequences
verify.hint: Ensure that you can generate a sequence of numbers from 1 to 10, with a step size of 2, using the `seq` command.

steps.title: Customize Numeric Sequences with Step Size and Formatting

verify.name: Verify customizing numeric sequences
verify.hint: Ensure that you can generate a sequence of numbers from 1 to 3, with a step size of 0.5, and format the output using the `%.2f` format specifier.
